items.title: The irreducible taxonomy
items.content:
3 core files cover 80%:
- taxonomy-architectures (how to structure)
- taxonomy-orchestration (how to coordinate)
- taxonomy-tools (how to extend)

Start with these three. Add others as needed.

items.title: Taxonomies = Periodic Table
items.content:
Just as the periodic table organizes elements by properties, these taxonomies organize patterns by function.

Architectures = Element families
Orchestration = Bonding rules
Tools = Lab equipment

items.title: Why these three are "core"
items.content:
ROOT: Every Claude Code system must answer:
1. How is it structured? (Architecture)
2. How does it coordinate? (Orchestration)
3. How does work flow? (Workflow)

Everything else builds on these foundations.

items.title: How to use these taxonomies
items.content:
Beginner: "What patterns exist?" - Scan categories
Intermediate: "What fits my use case?" - Use comparison matrices
Advanced: "How do patterns combine?" - Cross-reference section
Staff: "What are the tradeoffs?" - Decision trees

items.title: Deprecated vs. Active
items.content:
Now: Most core taxonomies marked "Deprecated"
Why: Content moved to D-FINAL synthesis
Implication: These files preserved for reference, but D-FINAL has latest

Active files (Tools, Skills, Enterprise) still canonical.

items.title: Local vs. Cloud deployment
items.content:
Local: Fast iteration, full control, no cost per token
Cloud: Scale, always-on, team access
Hybrid: Best of both but operational complexity

See deployment taxonomy decision tree for guidance.

items.title: If you ignore memory management
items.content:
IF: Skip context/memory taxonomy
THEN: Hit 200K token limit unexpectedly
THEN: Context rot degrades quality
THEN: Blame "Claude getting dumber"
FINALLY: Abandon multi-agent patterns

Memory management is not optional.

items.title: Tools + Skills + Enterprise Agents
items.content:
Tools: Infrastructure layer (hooks, MCP)
Skills: Capability layer (domain expertise)
Enterprise: Pre-built combinations

99-Agents = Tools + Skills pre-integrated

items.title: 99-Agents adoption
items.content:
"Started with a custom agent for each domain. Then found 99-Agents had 108 specialists ready to go. Saved weeks of prompt engineering."

Check enterprise taxonomy before building custom.

items.title: Skill composition patterns
items.content:
UNSOLVED: How do skills interact when multiple are loaded?
Current: Manual curation per project
Future: Dynamic skill selection based on task

items.title: Without cross-reference
items.content:
What if no index?
- Each taxonomy isolated
- Connections invisible
- Same concepts different names

Cross-reference reveals the hidden structure.

items.title: Beyond taxonomies
items.content:
Want tutorials? See /journeys/
Want comparisons? See compare-*.html
Want playbook? See MASTER-PLAYBOOK
Want decisions? See JUDGMENT-GUIDE
